div.p: EXCELLENT in VIRTUE OR in IMPORTANT SKILL.
1. The general term for positive appraisal of human capacities of any kind is shàn 善 (ant. è 惡 "bad").
2. Rén 仁 (ant. cán 殘 "unfeeling") refers to kind-heartedness as an attitude directed towards moral behaviour. See BENEVOLENCE
3. Lián 廉 (ant. tān 貪 "greedy for bribery gifts") refers to moral probity and impeccability.
4. Zhí 直 (ant. qǔ 曲 "devious") refers to moral straightforwardness and uprightness.
5. Zhōng 衷 (ant. xié 邪 "wicked") refers to devoted uprightness of character. See also EARNEST
6. Qīng 清 (ant. zhuó 濁 "defiled and corrupt") can be used to refer to moral purity.
7. Shú 淑 is a highly poetic word referring to admirable moral qualities in general, typically in women.
8. Jūn zǐ 君子 (ant. xiǎo rén 小人 "petty man") refers to high moral qualities and capacities, especially in men.

9. Zāng 臧 (pí 否 "good-for-nothing") is an archaic neutral unemotional objective term for goodness.

10. Rén yì 仁義, when it is not simply listing benevolence and righteousness, commonly refers quite generally (by synecdoche) to moral goodness or the moral virtues LIKE benevolence and righteousness and not in fact to just two of the virtues.

rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

GREEK KEYWORD:
αγαθός ή (dial, α) όν adj. | Lacon.masc.acc.pl. άγασώς (Ar.)
|| The compar. is supplied by άμείνων, άρείων, βελτίων (also
βέλτερος), κρείσσων, λωων (also λωίτερος) and φέρτερος.
| The superl. is supplied by άριστος, βέλτιστος (also
βέλτατος), κράτιστος (ep. κάρτιστος), λωστος and φέριστος
(also φέρτατος). |
1 (of persons, esp. in the performance of a specific role or
duty) good, capable Hom. +; (w.ACC. at an activity or in
some regard) Hom. +; (w.inf. at doing sthg.) Hdt. +; (w.dat.
or prep.phr. at sthg.) Lys. PL X.
2 (w.connot. of high birth) noble Hom. +; (w.connot. of
morality) good Thgn. +; (of a virtue) Od. Hes.
3 (of persons) trustworthy, loyal (to family, friends,
political allies, or sim.) Hdt. X.
4 (of thoughts, words, advice, or sim.) good, useful (sts.
W.DAT. for someone or sthg.) Hom. +; (of land, a day, a meal)
Hom. +; (of a treatment, W.GEN. for a condition) X.
5 (of a deity) without wickedness, beneficent, benevolent
PL Men.
6 (as the title of a deity, to whom a toast was made at the
end of a meal) good Ar.; (as the title of a goddess, at Rome)
Plu.
Ί (iron., of a ruler) esteemed, worthy S.
8 (in voc. address, friendly or sarcastic) ώ αγαθέ (or ώγαθέ)
my good man Ar. PL +
—αγαθόν οΰ η. 1 that which does good or is desirable,
benefit, advantage (ref. to a person or thing) Hom. +;
(prep.phr.) έπ’ άγαθω/or the good or to the advantage {sts.
w.gen. or dat. of someone or sthg.) Hdt. Th. Ar. + || pl. goods
or valuables Hdt. +; good foods Od. Thgn. Hdt. Ar.; prosperity
Ar.; good qualities or features (of a person or animal) Isoc. +
|| neut.impers. (w. έστί, sts.understd.) it is advantageous or
desirable —w.inf. to do sthg. Hom. +
2 (philos.) το αγαθόν the Good PL Arist
—άγαθώς adv. in a good or useful manner, well Arist.

bibl.title: A Dictionary of Selected Synonyms in the Principal Indo-European Languages
Vocabulaire européen des philosophies. Dictionnaire des intraduisibles

note.p: GUT
BONITAS est entis sufficientia sibi et alijs
Tribus ergo constat 1. Perfectione qvadam. 2. qva se perficit. 3. et alia perficere promptum est.
Detailed analysis.
GOOD
bonus refers to benevolence and goodness of heart as an ordinary virtue shared by decent persons.
bene moratus is a person who has cultivated features such as lack of selfishness, self-control and conscientiousness.
probus refers to uprightness, justness, moral worthiness.
honestus refers to a higher level of honourable and chivalrous spirit and demeanour.
sanctus refers to a saintly holy spirit based on religious piety.
HUMANENESS

humanitas is a virtue of universal extent, which, like the mental cultivation, proceeding from intelligence, ennobles the who man in mind and heart, and gives to his nature mildness and philanthropy, as a principle.
comitas refers to a moral virtue, which, like affability, without respect to higher rank in society, treats every person with proper attention and respect.
facilitas refers to a social virtue, which, like complaisance, by forbearance and meeting the views of others, facilitates mutual intercourse in life, and makes social interaction pleasant.
civiliatas refers to political virtue which, like the rpublican feeling of a prince, makes the spi8cific difference between a ruler and his people unfelt, and treats his subject s as fellow citizens.
humanitus refers to action as being "merely human" and not possessed of divine authority.
humane and humaniter refer to a person's cultivated sensibility for what deserves respect in humans.
P. Herrmann, Menschliche Wertbegriffe bei Homer agathos, esthlos..., Diss Hamburg 1954

sense.def: trusty and even-handed (also towards one's inferiors
be trusty and even-handed (towads the people)
trustiness and unbiased even-handedness (to superiors and inferiors)
deal even-handedly and trustily with (the people etc)

entry.def: Rén 仁 (ant. cán 殘 "unfeeling") refers to kind-heartedness as an attitude directed towards moral behaviour. See BENEVOLENCE.

sense.def: moral excellence; goodness; goodness of heart
archaic: impressive in a contrived way; attractive
things will be all right, things are all right 如之何則可？
be morally acceptable; be acceptable; be OK; be advisable

entry.def: The general term for positive appraisal of any kind in Chinese is shàn 善 (ant. è 惡 "bad").

sense.def: what is morally excellent; moral excellence; what is good
kinds of moral action, modes of goodness
goodness，moral excellence in action; acts of goodness
goodness of attitude; moral goodness; moral excellence
good (善法 not of the dharmas the good ones, but the Buddhist dharma, which is good)
be good in action; be morally excellent; be socially acceptable
consider to be good, regard as good
to make N morally good； improve morally

bibl.title: 簡明古漢語同義詞詞典

sense.def: what is morally good > the good

entry.def: Lián 廉 (ant. tān 貪 "greedy for bribery gifts") refers to moral probity and impeccability.

sense.def: moral integrity, integrity; (one's example of) moral impeccability
the morally pure; the incorruptible; the scrupulous, the honest men; those who are impeccable
be impeccable; be morally incorruptible, show moral purity, be morally scrupulous; be impeccably honest
the set of the morally pure, the incorruptible
fair empathy for others; non-discriminating considerateness; mindfulness of others' concerns
be empathetic mindfulness of the concerns of others
fair empathy for others; non-discriminating considerateness; mindfulness of the concerns of others
mindfully of the concerns of others
be mindful of the concerns of others, fair and empathetic
take a fair overall perspective; be non-discriminating and considerate; be sensitive
worthy of assent > good, proper, right
be good; be right; also: be the right thing to do

entry.def: Qīng 清 (ant. zhuó 濁 "defiled and corrupt") can be used to refer to moral purity.

sense.def: impeccable ritual purity and propriety in action
the impeccable, the morally pure, the immaculate

entry.def: Shú 淑 is a highly poetic word referring to admirable moral qualities in general, typically in women.

sense.def: declare to be poetically and morally exquisite
gentleness; kindness; genteel warmth in social relations
be immaculate and morally pure with respect to
the contextually determinate N's moral purity
cause to appear morally undefiled and pure> exculpate

entry.def: Zhí 直 (ant. qǔ 曲 "devious") refers to moral straightforwardness and uprightness.

sense.def: moral straightness, moral straightforwardness; straightforward goodness
act in a morally straight way
be straightforward and good with respect to
moral attractiveness, feature of being honourable
those who are honourable and admirable
what is good in N, good points in the person N
declare to be excellent or good

entry.def: Zāng 臧 (pí 否 "good-for-nothing") is a neutral unemotional objective term for goodness.
Zhōng 衷 (ant. xié 邪 "wicked") refers to devoted uprightness of character. See also EARNEST
Xián 賢 (ant. 不肖"person of inferior worth and talent") adds to the notion of an intellectual of some education that of special talent, and sometimes also of moral worth. See TALENT.

sense.def: person of talent; person of moral worth, a worthy
be worthy, have moral worth and talent, be morally excellent; also BUDDH.
what is in accordance to the Way
be according to the way; be good and proper
act according to the good and proper Way
be good and appropriate to the occasion
be good (梅堯臣 《感李花》詩："當時 李白 欲騎鯨，醉向 江 南曾不錯。")

entry.def: This refers to morality in general, including virtues other than those mentioned explicitly in the binome.

sense.def: the kind-hearted and righteous, those who have moral principles
moral principles such as benevolence and righteousness
moral appropriate behaviour characterised by such virtues as benevolence and righteousness
characterised by kind-heartedness and rectitude> moral
be morally principled and kindly; be good
concerning or characterised by the moral principles (like those of benevolence and righteousness etc)

A Dictionary of Chinese Buddhist Terms

sense.def: BUDDH: the ten good deeds, usually defined as the avoidance of the ten evil deeds or cardinal sins; compare shíshàn zhèngfǎ 十善正法 "The ten good characterstics, or virtues, defined as the non-committal of the ten evils (shíè 十惡)." (SOOTHILL: 47); compare also shíshàn shíè 十善十惡, skr. daśakuśala-karmāni

entry.def: Jūn zǐ 君子 (ant. xiǎo rén 小人 "petty man") refers to high moral qualities, especially in men.

sense.def: the true gentlemen; the men of noble character (of a certain time or place) [predicate tensed] 古之君子
true gentlemen, people of moral superior character
a true gentleman; a person of superior character; the person of superior character 得見君子者斯可矣。
the notion of a true gentleman; person of superior character 子路問君子
being a true gentleman; acting like a gentleman 射有似乎君子
gentlemanly, of the gentlemanly type 女為君子儒
characteristic of a true gentleman; in modifying position 君子之道 [NOT: the Way of gentleman X]
true gentleman;distinguished man of superior character 此六君子者
to behave as a true gentleman, to comport oneself as a true gentleman 其爭也君子
be gentlemanly; be high-minded 君子哉！; be superior as a person 不亦君子乎; be worthy of a person of superior character
a true gentleman; a man of character
be fond of (exercising) human-heartedness; tend to be human-hearted
the virtues of respectful politeness within the family
have all the virtues of respectful politenes within the family
moral integrity and proper sense of shame> moral integrity
be impeccable DCD: 1.正；直；不偏斜。 2.整齊勻稱。 3.正直不邪。 4.妥帖；停當。
perfectly decent, highly proper, utterly upright
(of things) nothing comes up to> the best thing is to
those who are decent and good
all sorts of moral and professional excellence
prevalence of goodness versus badness (in a place); feature of goodness/badness as expressed in 君子 and 小人 (prevailing in a place)
be morally thoughtful, be morally perfect
consider oneself as morally supreme and sage-like
ultimate goodness; what is perfectly good
those who are worthy, those who are morally good
those who are worthy, those who are morally good
be overally mild and gentle, be amiable
personal notions of what is good (for one)
having the sense of what is proper; moral
be perfectly honest; be completely incorruptible; be morally quite impeccable
